00020 /****************************************************************************/
00021 #ifndef _HASH_SUPPORT_HH_
00022 #define _HASH_SUPPORT_HH_
00023 
00024 #include <utility>
00025 #include <set>
00026 #include <vector>
00027 #include <typeinfo>
00028 #include "hashfunc.hh"
00029 
00030 namespace d3 { namespace util {
00031 
00032 // Basic definition of a d3 hash function : define a member function : size_t hash() const , in hashable classes 
00033 template<typename T>
00034 struct hash
00035 {
00036   size_t 
00037   operator()(const T &e) const
00038   {
00039     return e.hash();
00040   }
00041 };
00042 
00043 // Basic definition of a d3 equality test : define a member function : bool operator== (const T & )const , in comparable classes 
00044 template<typename T>
00045 struct equal
00046 {
00047   bool
00048   operator()(const T &e1,const T &e2) const
00049   {
00050     return e1==e2;
00051   }
00052 };
00053 
00054 // Specialized version for storage of pointers to hashable objects. 
00055 template <typename T>
00056 struct hash<T*>
00057 {
00058   size_t 
00059   operator()(const T* e) const
00060   {
00061     return e->hash();
00062   }
00063 };
00064 
00065 // Specialized version for storage of pointers to comparable objects. Perform deep comparison.
00066 template<typename T>
00067 struct equal<T*>
00068 {
00069   bool
00070   operator()(const T* e1,const T* e2) const
00071   {
00072     return (typeid(*e1)==typeid(*e2)?(*e1)==(*e2):false);
00073   }
00074 };
00075 
00076 // Specialized version for use of int as keys in hash_map
00077 template<>
00078 struct hash<int> {
00079   size_t operator()(int i) const {
00080     return ddd::wang32_hash(i);
00081   };
00082  };
00083 
00084 // Specialized version for std::pair of hashable objects.
00085 template <typename T1,typename T2>
00086 struct hash<std::pair<T1,T2> > {
00087   size_t operator() (const std::pair<T1,T2> &p)const {
00088     return hash<T1>()(p.first) ^ hash<T2>()(p.second);
00089   };
00090 };
00091 
00092 
00093 // Specialized version for std::set of hashable objects.
00094 template <typename T1>
00095 struct hash<std::set<T1> > {
00096   size_t operator() (const std::set<T1> &p)const {
00097     size_t res = 11317;
00098     typename std::set<T1>::const_iterator it;
00099     for ( it = p.begin() ; it != p.end() ; ++it )
00100       res ^= it->hash();
00101     return res;
00102   };
00103 };
00104 // Specialized version for std::vector<int>.
00105 template <>
00106 struct hash<const std::vector<int> > {
00107   size_t operator() (const std::vector<int> &p)const {
00108     size_t res = 2473;
00109     std::vector<int>::const_iterator it;
00110     for ( it = p.begin() ; it != p.end() ; ++it )
00111       res ^= (ddd::wang32_hash(*it)* res);
00112     return res;
00113   };
00114 };
00115 // could this be removed somehow ??
00116 template <>
00117 struct hash<std::vector<int> > {
00118   size_t operator() (const std::vector<int> &p)const {
00119     return hash<const std::vector<int> > () (p);
00120   };
00121 };
00122 
00123 
00124 template <>
00125 struct hash<std::vector<int>* > {
00126   size_t operator() (const std::vector<int> *p)const {    
00127     return hash<const std::vector<int> > () (*p);
00128   };
00129 };
00130 template <>
00131 struct hash<const std::vector<int>* > {
00132   size_t operator() (const std::vector<int> *p)const {    
00133     return hash<const std::vector<int> > () (*p);
00134   };
00135 };
00136 
00137 // Specialized version for std::pair of comparable objects.
00138 template<typename T1,typename T2>
00139 struct equal<std::pair<T1,T2> >
00140 {
00141   bool
00142   operator()(const std::pair<T1,T2> & e1,const std::pair<T1,T2>& e2) const
00143   {
00144     return equal<T1>()(e1.first,e2.first) && equal<T2>()(e1.second,e2.second);
00145   }
00146 };
00147
